title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 §§ 79-7.4 - [Effective 12/22/2025] Professional licensing examinations
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 §§ 79-7.4 - [Effective 12/22/2025] Professional licensing examinations

State Regulations
(a) The department may accept a passing score
on an examination determined by the department to be acceptable for licensure
as a licensed athletic trainer. (b) Education requirements for admission. Notwithstanding the provisions of section
59.9
of this Title, an applicant
for licensure shall not be required to satisfy all education requirements
before being admitted to a professional licensing examination in athletic
training. Such education shall be completed prior to licensure. (c) Grade retention. The grade retention
limitations of section
59.5
(f) of this

Title shall not be applicable to a professional licensing examination in
athletic training. (d) Passing
standard. The passing standard for each examination shall be a standard
acceptable to the State Board for Medicine in consultation with the State

Committee for Athletic Trainers. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8
§§
79-7.4

Amended

New

York State Register April 23, 2025/Volume XLVII, Issue 16, eff. 12/22/2025

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
